subtitle: Safer FOOD in drought - the 5 Keys
description: How to prepare and handle food
title: Safer FOOD in drought - the 5 Keys
content:
1. Keep clean
Wash your hands with running water before handling food and often during food preperation
Wash your hands with running water after using the toilet
Wash and sanitise all surfaces and equipment used for food preparation
Protect kitchen area and food from insects, pests and other animals
 2. Separate raw and cooked food
Separate raw meat, poultry and seafood from other foods
Use separate equipment and utensils such as knives and cutting boards for handling raw food
Store food in containers to avoid contact between raw and prepared food
 3. Cook thoroughly, especially meat, poultry, egg and seafood
Reheat cooked food thoroughly
Bring foods like soup and stews to boil to make sure that they reached 70°C
